result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A. Colby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with G. Kuehn directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A. Colby

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:49 p.m. Defendant Steven A. Colby in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Defendant Steven A. Colby in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Repeater enhancer dismissed and read in. Statement by DE. Court orders: 60 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation concurrent to any existing sentence - Conditions: NC w/ G. Kuehn, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

9:13 am case called. Defendant Steven A. Colby in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

1:24 pm case called. Defendant Steven A. Colby in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Steven A. Colby in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated -defendant has received a copy but Attorney Szilagyi has not. Riverside ruling in favor of State.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 09:15 am.
